description: Situated astride Lake Ontario, Scarborough is a district heavily influenced by immigration. With a number of low-rent shopping and dining options making it a highly affordable part of town, and boasting one of Toronto's largest shopping malls, the otherwise green suburban neighborhood is a good place to go for bargains and discounts. It also draws in photographers. The spires, archways, and cavernous rooms of the BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir Palace are filled with breathtaking art, architecture, and detailed reliefs ‚Äì it‚Äôs like entering a different world, The ruins of columns and installation art at the Guild Inn makes a free-for-all exploration site, while the big-name draw for young photographers is the menagerie at the Toronto Zoo. While many visitors shirk Scarborough as too suburban, its houses are some of Toronto's most mystical and haunting architectural beauties. And for adventure lovers, it has river-rafting and some unique hiking trails.

reviews.title: Wonderful even in winter
text: Even witj the snow the garden is beautiful and not busy at all. Wonderful for a winter walk ofcourse the flowers armt out but if you go after a light snow fall it's magical

reviews.title: lot of Squirrels playing around.
text: Lot of Squirrels and birds playing around. Best place to bring family and friends. Clean and quite place.

reviews.title: Serene, beautiful, relaxing
text: We went to this place on a weekend. The place was serene with beautiful flowers. There are benches to sit and relax.
The parking is free and there is washroom.
Near to this place are Starbucks, KFC, MexiTaco restaurant, St. Theresa's Parish, Shrine of the Little Flower church  and bluffers park is near by.

reviews.title: Good solo coffee spot
text: This is a nice quiet place to go relax, sit down, enjoy a hot coffee and watch the birds.
I prefer early, cool spring and autumn mornings. Like 6-7am.

reviews.title: Rosetta McClain Gardens is a beautiful GARDEN, not a park
text: I have been visiting this GARDEN for over 25 years. It is beautiful, relaxing and nature inspiring.  It‚Äôs the place to come to walk or sit to unwind, relax and appreciate its beauty.  As the signs state that are posted at all entrances: DOGS, PICNICS, BICYCLE RIDING, ANY BALL ACTIVITY, ROLLERBLADES AND SKATEBOARDING ARE NOT ALLOWED (service animals exempt).  Unfortunately people are disrespecting the beauty of the GARDEN and the rules.

There have been some Cyclists who have raced through the gardens and swore to those who asked them to dismount as per the rules. One of the cyclist was so annoyed to be told the rules that he rode across the manicured grass to prove his point!
A family simply decided that the rules didn‚Äôt apply to them when they arrived with their pizza boxes and foods.

Dog owners who feel justified to walk their dog anywhere they chose despite knowing that there is an off leash secure dog park right around the corner. One bad dog owner threatened to have his dog attack the city worker when he asked him to leave with his dog.
A couple were spotted walking with a large bouquet of lilacs. How dare they steal from the garden. Of course they said that they found them on the ground and didn‚Äôt tear them off the trees.

These are just some real and recent examples to remind folks to enjoy the GARDENS. Please follow the rules to protect the gardens and those who are visiting. If a park is what you are looking for then this is not the place and there are many, many great parks in Toronto to enjoy. However, if you would like to bird watch, enjoy the flowers, plants, enjoy the Bluffs view, feed the squirrels, chipmunks, blue Jays and cardinals then this GARDEN is perfect for you!

reviews.title: Amazing!
text: Best park in Toronto! We saw many animals and birds. It's the best place for photos! Peaceful and beautiful!

reviews.title: Beautiful Garden!
text: I went birding here and thought it was fantastic! Very green, overlooking the bluffs with beautiful birds here as well

reviews.title: Nice place, not so well maintained the roses part
text: The park and the place is very nice, with a fountain in the middle. The part with lots of roses is not so well maintained.

reviews.title: Little Known Gem
text: We've been going to this little park for many years; every time we go we marvel at the many species of trees (some are huge providing plenty of deep shade) the beautiful flower gardens and the verdant green of the lawns.
It is perched on the bluffs so has a commanding view of Lake Ontario .
Especially nice on hot sultry days because of the cooling breeze coming off the lake .
Go for an hour or while away an afternoon on a blanket with a picnic .
Birders may like this place as I've seen quite a few curtiosities passing through in spring and fall.
There is limited parking, but I've never been shut out.

reviews.title: A Magnificent splendor of beauty
text: Serene, and picturesque overlooking Lake Ontario, this is one of the most beautiful parks I have ever visited. I visit this park every summer and spend hours enjoying it's magnificent  splendor.

reviews.title: Hidden Beauty
text: For the longest time I have driven past this place without a second thought. I saw tthe sign but some reason I didn't think it was going to be anything special. Until a friend of mine told me I had to go. Beautiful flowers and landscaping plus a view of Lake Ontario.
It can be quite busy on weekends with limited parking.
I am not sure but I heard that no food or pets are allowed in the park. You may want to check.

reviews.title: Great Gardens, wildlife and birding all combined in this hidden gem
text: A hidden gem of a garden that changes every year. The center pice of the gardens features a large rock with water flowing out of the top. Along with the many plants and flowers several rare trees are also found within the 3 acre gardens with newly paved walking paths covering the entire garden. The gardens also has a very fine rose garden, a large gazebo to rest in and some ruins of the original building that once stood here.  Along with the flowers a great array of animals, squirrels who constantly beg you for peanuts and afford very close encounters with them. early mornings can see deer, foxes, raccoons passing through. Above hawks migrate through the park in the fall. Along with many different species of birds especially hummingbirds. In the spring a large assortment of Warblers pass through making it a birders paradise before the flowers and plants begin to bloom. Fully accessible washrooms, drinking fountain. Since it is a garden no picnics, bike riding, dogs, are allowed in the garden. Great views of Lake Ontario, and on clear days the towers and spray of Niagara Falls are visable

reviews.title: Like a walk through a magical secret garden!
text: This park is wonderful, almost like a magical secret garden! The gardens are beautifully maintained and the property is large. It is easily accessed off Kingston Road when driving northeast but you do have to watch carefully for the entrance onto Glen Everest Road... or use Google maps. üòÄ   There is a parking lot as well as restroom facilities

The design includes beautiful and well maintained flower beds that change with the seasons, lots of benches and quiet places to sit, mature trees, and a centre pergola filled with beds of gorgeous flowers around a rock fountain. Butterflies abound and as you walk along the many paths you will notice various types of birds. I have encountered groups of birdwatchers from time to time.

People often sit and visit, or read, or sketch, or paint...it is that kind of a park. The views of Lake Ontario are spectacular.  If you walk to the most easterly point in the park you will find a very nice rose garden as well as a folly that looks like the ruins of a farm house - great fun and you can safely walk through it. I love the story of how the land was donated by Rosetta's husband after her death...a generous and enduring gift.
I have visited at various times throughout the year and always enjoyed it.

reviews.title: Discovered it by chance - and loved it!
text: We found this garden by chance while staying at the Days' Inn on Kingston Road (a few steps away).  We met some friendly people there, and thought the gardens were truly a beauty (free parking and access thrown in!). A wonderful view of Lake Ontario and "the Bluffs" was also a nice surprise.

reviews.title: Fantastic Park and Gardens on the Scarborough Bluffs
text: This horticultural park is possibly more beautiful that the better known Edwards gardens. Besides being located 180' above Lake Ontario on the Bluffs and providing spectacular views, the park has beautifully laid our and marvelously maintained annual and perennial beds and a wonderful collection of trees and shrubs, most well identified. We gather that the gardens are often rented for weddings and it is easy to understand why. Toronto Parks and Recreation maintain the gardens and should be congratulated for a job well done.

reviews.title: A first visit
text: I've heard about these gardens for a few years and finally got to visit yesterday.  They are just beautiful and at this time of year not crowded.  It was a perfect day to see so many monarchs fluttering around.  Most impressive where the old trees and the great variety - no clumps of the same species.  It was delightful and we saw two weddings to boot.

reviews.title: Beautiful park
text: It's a lovely park near the Scarborough Bluffs. It's not worth coming all this way just to see this one attraction but if you're in the neighborhood it's worth a visit.

reviews.title: Wonderful Lake View
text: A most attractive City of Toronto Park in Scarborough.  On the flyway so many migrating birds with a good view of raptors.  Well-maintained formal gardens.

reviews.title: Beautiful location and experience no matter the season
text: Great setting for photos, walking, meditating, bird watching or boat watching. Great for children who love exploring all the walkways and crevices and seniors who will enjoy the sense of nature. My mom who suffered from Alzheimer's had some of her calmest moments feeding the birds and squirrels in this park. It will always hold a special place for us.

reviews.title: This is my all-time favourite Toronto park
text: There's something magical about Rosetta McClain Gardens, and I'm not quite sure I can put my finger on it. Perhaps it's the location, perched high above Lake Ontario. Perhaps it's the variety of trees on the site, many of them over 100' in height. It might be the squirrels, curious and nearly unafraid, hopeful for a snack. Obviously it's the flowers and ornamental plants, so carefully selected and artfully displayed. Even the fountain somehow manages to be unique and inviting. Please don't go here; I want to keep it for myself!

reviews.title: Hidden Beauty
text: Rosetta McClain Gardens is a hidden gem - even those of us very familiar with Scarborough might not know it's there. I first visited this garden 30 years ago - and the structure is still the same... the paths still look familiar. The City has invested in some lovely landscaping and is focusing on planting nectar plants for the dozens of monarchs who use this area as part of their annual southward migration each September. This is a photographer's dream - beautiful blossoms, birds like blue jays and goldfinches daily, birds of prey on the edges of the lake, and monarchs. Picnics are not allowed

reviews.title: My place to reflect and relax
text: This is a garden hidden off Kingston Road East of Birchmount, across from the Birchmount stadium field. It is a gorgeous garden with a nice area to sit by the huge rock fountain. Birds squirrels and flowers you won't believe. Kudos to the City staff who maintain this place. Also has public washrooms and handicapped parking. On the bluff overlooking Lake Ontario. A nice place for a walk, or just sit and reflect and relax.

reviews.title: A peaceful escape in a busy city!
text: I've visted this lovely, tranquil 'garden park' many times over the past few years, and always enjoy my time there -- beautiful gardens & waking paths overlooking the Scarborough Bluffs & Lake Ontario. Lots of friendly, almost tame, black & grey  squirrels, and even some tiny red ones, running up & down the many trees, all eager to eat the peanuts I bring, as are the cardinals & grackles who swoop in & out. A quiet, tranquil place because no dogs, bikes, skateboards, ball sports, BBQs, picnics, etc are allowed.

reviews.title: Attractive Gardens on the Waterfront
text: Nicely kept gardens with parking.  Be sure to take the paved trail eastward to a nice rose garden.  We usually visit on the way to Bluffers Park, which is a 5 minute drive east.

reviews.title: Good for botanical photography, bird watching, or just relaxing
text: I'm a photographer and I regularly go here for the great selection of flowers. I also love to spot a hummingbird when I'm lucky. From spring to winter, I find some interesting material to photograph. During the migrating seasons (March/September) many birdwatchers gather with their binoculars to watch and count the many  bird kinds during migration. Also a nice place for monarch butterflies.
No dogs are allowed in the park. There are good restrooms and fountains. The park is open all hours.
